sub_title: Lecturer / Scientist Chemistry at HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
summary:
I am an experienced, practical and creative scientist (chemist), projectleader and lecturer. My strength is to identify the fundamental questions in applied projects and to translate fundamental knowledge into real, applied solutions that give a competitive edge. I enjoy solving puzzles where I can employ my strong analytical mind and experimental skills to translate application requirements into the development of novel, suitable materials. My experience in, and leading of, multidisciplinary R&D projects enables me to communicate effectively with researchers from other disciplines. As a mentor/coach and lecturer I support and empower co-workers and students in their own development.

I have over 15 years of experience at Philips Research, in various projects as senior scientist and later as project leader. Since 2011 I am also an assistant professor at Utrecht University.
An overview of these projects and activities in Philips and Utrecht can be found in my list of experience in my profile. The projects shared several activities and responsibilities, which are summarised here:
- Development of novel materials and devices for optical and electronic applications
- Project leading: planning, resource management, reporting to customers
- Coaching co-workers and mentoring students
- Generation of intellectual property (6 US patents granted, 19 pending)
- Initiating, maintaining and strengthening contacts with suppliers, customers and partners, as well as academic institutions, resulting in several collaborations
- Managing laboratory facilities & build-up/maintenance of measurement equipment and setups

Areas of expertise: organic chemistry, polymers, sustainability, colloid chemistry & physics, soft condensed matter, nanomaterials, quantum dots, co-ordination chemistry and homogeneous catalysis.
